3.Pros: I started out at the bottom, but was promoted quickly and earned management position after one year. Though the work environment is ever changing due to a high turn over rate, the management was friendly, encouraging, and held me accountable. I learned a lot of people skills and hard work with long hours and hard work ethic. If you are dependable, personable, and eager to work, you will go far!
3.Cons: The cons are really up to you. Lots of workers I saw were treating the job poorly because they were not applying themselves fully due to the fact that it is MacDonalds. But if you show up on time, do your tasks quickly and with intention to do them well, and respect management and others, you won't find it hard to succeed. But if you come with a bad attitude, come late often, don't put in the hours when asked, or treat customers/fellow employees with rudeness, you're not going to last long and will likely see newer employees promoted before you.
